experiment_description: Synthesis of Aspirin (Acetylsalicylic Acid) via O-acetylation of Salicylic Acid. Required instruments: ThermostaticWaterBath, ElectronicScale, SuctionFlask, InfraredSpectrophotometer. Required reagents: SalicylicAcid, AceticAnhydride, SulfuricAcid.

procedure.description: Weigh approximately 3.0 g of SalicylicAcid using the ElectronicScale.
Move the ErlenmeyerFlask containing SalicylicAcid to the FumeHood.
procedure.safety_notes: Prepare for addition of volatile reagents.

procedure.description: Add 6 mL of AceticAnhydride to the ErlenmeyerFlask.
procedure.safety_notes: Acetic Anhydride is corrosive and lachrymatory. Perform strictly in FumeHood.

procedure.description: Add 5-8 drops of SulfuricAcid to the mixture using a Pipette.
procedure.safety_notes: Sulfuric Acid is highly corrosive. Handle with extreme care.

procedure.description: Mix the contents gently using a GlassRod.
Heat the ErlenmeyerFlask in the ThermostaticWaterBath at 50-60Â°C for 15 minutes.
procedure.safety_notes: Monitor temperature carefully. Keep face away from vapors.

procedure.description: Remove flask from heat and carefully add 20 mL of Water to decompose excess AceticAnhydride.
procedure.safety_notes: Reaction may be exothermic and release acetic acid vapors. Keep in FumeHood.

procedure.description: Cool the mixture in an ice bath (Beaker with ice/water) to induce crystallization.
procedure.safety_notes: Scratch the side of the flask with GlassRod if necessary to start crystallization.

procedure.description: Set up the SuctionFlask and GlassFunnel for vacuum filtration.
Filter the crystals and wash with a small amount of cold Ethanol/Water mixture.
procedure.safety_notes: Ethanol is flammable. Ensure no heat sources are nearby during washing.

procedure.description: Transfer the solid product to a watch glass (or clean paper) to dry.
Weigh the dried Aspirin product on the ElectronicScale.
Analyze a sample of the product using the InfraredSpectrophotometer.
procedure.safety_notes: Clean the sample holder after use.

safety_warnings: Acetic Anhydride causes severe burns and eye damage; vapor is irritating.
Sulfuric Acid is a strong oxidizer and corrosive; avoid contact with skin and eyes.
Perform all heating and mixing of volatile reagents in the Fume Hood.
notes: Ice is required for the cooling step but is represented by Water in the asset list. Filter paper is assumed to be available for the GlassFunnel.
